job_text: ['', ' Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them. ', " Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You're not afraid to share a new idea. ", 'The Ideal Candidate Is', ' At least 1 year of experience with relational databases ', ' Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver a product customers love ', 'Team Description', ' Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver a product customers love  Leverage a broad stack of technologies - Python, Conda, AWS, H2O, Spark, and more - to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data  Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation  Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals ', ' Customer first. You love the process of analyzing and creating, but also share our passion to do the right thing. You know at the end of the day it\'s about making the right decision for our customers.  Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them.  Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You\'re not afraid to share a new idea.  A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. Your passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond.  Technical. You\'re comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms.  Statistically-minded. You\'ve built models, validated them, and backtested them. You know how to interpret a confusion matrix or a ROC curve. You have experience with clustering, classification, sentiment analysis, time series, and deep learning.  A data guru. "Big data" doesn\'t phase you. You have the skills to retrieve, combine, and analyze data from a variety of sources and structures. You know understanding the data is often the key to great data science. ', ' Master\'s Degree in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) Experience in Optimization or time-series modeling techniques  At least 1 year of experience working with AWS  At least 3 years\' experience in Python, Scala, or R  At least 3 years\' experience with machine learning  At least 3 years\' experience with SQL ', " At least 3 years' experience with SQL ", " Technical. You're comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms. ", " At least 3 years' experience with machine learning ", 'Basic Qualifications', ' A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. Your passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond. ', ' At least 1 year of experience working with AWS ', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. ', " Bachelor's Degree plus 5 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 3 years in data analytics, or PhD ", ' Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation ', ' Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals ', ' Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.', " Bachelor's Degree plus 5 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 3 years in data analytics, or PhD  At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis  At least 1 year of experience with machine learning  At least 1 year of experience with relational databases ", ' This role offers a a unique opportunity to be part of a dynamic analytics and modeling team focused on developing behavior models for balance sheet portfolios. We are currently looking for candidates with strong modeling and analytical skills. This position will work with other quantitative analysts, data scientists, and the business analysts in developing and enhancing the deposit modeling framework to support multiple business purposes in Capital One. ', " At least 3 years' experience in Python, Scala, or R ", " Statistically-minded. You've built models, validated them, and backtested them. You know how to interpret a confusion matrix or a ROC curve. You have experience with clustering, classification, sentiment analysis, time series, and deep learning. ", ' At least 1 year of experience with machine learning ', " Customer first. You love the process of analyzing and creating, but also share our passion to do the right thing. You know at the end of the day it's about making the right decision for our customers. ", 'In This Role, You Will', 'Experience in Optimization or time-series modeling techniques ', ' A data guru. "Big data" doesn\'t phase you. You have the skills to retrieve, combine, and analyze data from a variety of sources and structures. You know understanding the data is often the key to great data science. ', ' At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis ', " As a Data Scientist at the Retail and Direct Bank, you'll be part of a high performing modeling and analytics team that's is on a mission to define the next generation of banking. The Bank team has a relentless focus on the craft of statistical modeling and innovation with a target towards continually improving decision making and delivering value to the business. ", ' Master\'s Degree in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) ', ' Leverage a broad stack of technologies - Python, Conda, AWS, H2O, Spark, and more - to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data ']

', 'A one-year probationary period may be required upon selection/placement.', 'Summary', 'Fair & TransparentThe Federal hiring process is setup to be fair and transparent. Please read the following guidance.Equal Employment Opportunity PolicyThe United States Government does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.Reasonable Accommodation PolicyFederal agencies must provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process should follow the instructions in the job opportunity announcement. For any part of the remaining hiring process, applicants should contact the hiring agency directly. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.A reasonable accommodation is any change to a job, the work environment, or the way things are usually done that enables an individual with a disability to apply for a job, perform job duties or receive equal access to job benefits.Under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, federal agencies must provide reasonable accommodations when: An applicant with a disability needs an accommodation to have an equal opportunity to apply for a job. An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to perform the essential job duties or to gain access to the workplace. An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to receive equal access to benefits, such as details, training, and office-sponsored events. You can request a reasonable accommodation at any time during the application or hiring process or while on the job. Employment is subject to the successful completion of the pre-appointment process (i.e., background investigation, verification of qualifications and job requirements, completion of onboarding forms, submission of required documents, etc.) Males born after December 31, 1959 must be registered with the Selective Service. Applicants must meet all qualifications requirements within thirty (30) calendar days of the closing date of this announcement, including time in grade. This position has an Education Requirement. QualificationsBasic Qualifications:You must demonstrate in your resume at least One (1) full year of graduate or higher-level education in the medical field, health sciences, or allied sciences in an accredited college or university, in addition to completion of all work required for a bachelor\'s degree.Additional QualificationsYou must demonstrate in your resume at least one (1) year of qualifying experience equivalent to at least the GS-14 level in the Federal Government, performing the following types of tasks: identifying the conceptual formulation, design and implementation of data; applying analytical, machine learning, visualization and reporting tools to data sets; providing guidance as a recognized expert on the use of information retrieval and extraction techniques.Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.Preview Assessment Questionnaire Before You ApplyEducationThis position has an education requirement. You are strongly encouraged to submit a copy of your transcripts (or a list of your courses including titles, credit hours completed and grades). BenefitsA career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding.Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered. How to ApplyTo apply for this position, please read and follow all instructions in this announcement, complete the online application, and submit the documentation specified in the "Required Documents" section. Your complete application package must be submitted by 11:59 PM Eastern Time (ET) on 12/05/2020 to receive consideration. To begin, click Apply to access the online application. You will need to be logged into your USAJOBS account to apply.  Follow the prompts to select your resume and/or other supporting documents to be included with your application package. See the "Required Documents" section for any additional forms and/or supplemental materials required.  Read all Eligibility questions and respond accordingly to any Eligibility you wish to claim. You will only be considered for those Eligibility questions (Status Applicant, Reinstatement, Schedule A, etc.) you respond in the affirmative to, regardless of what documentation you submit. We cannot assume you intended to respond differently to a question based on other information in your application package.  Complete the assessment questionnaire. Applicants are asked all questions regardless of their consideration preferences. We will only consider you for the grades, series, locations, specialties, and other considerations that you self-identify as being qualified for or interested in. Preview assessment questionnaire before you apply:  Verify all required documentation is included in your application package, review your responses to the assessment questionnaire for accuracy, and then submit your application. In addition to the required documents, we encourage you to submit a cover letter, copy of your transcripts, and any applicable certifications or licenses. Even though this information is not required at the time of application, we may request this information later.We cannot assume responsibility or grant extensions for personal issues (e.g., troubles navigating the application process, loss of internet, not understanding a question) when applying to our announcements. For technical difficulties, contact HR Systems Support between 8:00 AM and 4:30 PM ET Monday through Friday atIf you need any other accommodation or assistance with applying please contact Sabina Green at greenso@mail.nih.gov. Requests for reasonable accommodations must be made before the announcement closing date.Agency contact informationSabina GreenPhoneEmailAddressNational Institutes of Health2115 East Jefferson StreetRockville, MD 20851USNext stepsOnce you submit your application package, you will receive an acknowledgement email. You will be notified of the status of your applications via email. In addition, you can track the progress of your application package through yourAt the discretion of the agency, you may be contacted via phone or email for an interview or to provide additional information up to several months from the closing date of the announcement. Please ensure you have provided accurate contact information. To remain in consideration, you must respond in a timely manner to our correspondence and requests for documentation or information throughout the hiring process.  Fair & TransparentThe Federal hiring process is setup to be fair and transparent. Please read the following guidance.Equal Employment Opportunity PolicyThe United States Government does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.Reasonable Accommodation PolicyFederal agencies must provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process should follow the instructions in the job opportunity announcement. For any part of the remaining hiring process, applicants should contact the hiring agency directly. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.A reasonable accommodation is any change to a job, the work environment, or the way things are usually done that enables an individual with a disability to apply for a job, perform job duties or receive equal access to job benefits.Under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, federal agencies must provide reasonable accommodations when: An applicant with a disability needs an accommodation to have an equal opportunity to apply for a job. An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to perform the essential job duties or to gain access to the workplace. An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to receive equal access to benefits, such as details, training, and office-sponsored events. You can request a reasonable accommodation at any time during the application or hiring process or while on the job. Formulate process improvement suggestions through ad hoc analyses and data mining. ', 'Knowledge of Microbiology and Biochemistry as they relate to bacteria, yeast, and fungi. ['', '26,000+ employees across 50 countries', 'Market-leading products in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution', ' You possess a bachelor’s degree and 5+ years’ search experience with a retained search firm and/or in-house recruiting team focused on leadership roles in the digital/SaaS space. You are results-driven with a strong sense of urgency under ever-changing circumstances. ['', 'Necessary Skills / Attributes ', 'Years of experience: ', ' User Research: Before designing UX concept, usability      specialist does research what users need, what pain points are, and what      users like to have. Usability specialist interview, ask questions, or      observe users to get insights on the needs. They also research current      product and industry trends to make recommendations.  Usability Testing: While or after engineers develop a      prototype or an application of a product, the usability specialist      organizes Usability Testing of the product by users, observes the tests      and asks participants detailed questions. After testing, usability      specialist analyze the result analyzes the results of the testing and      prepares a report of their recommendations, giving the report to the      engineers, UX designers, and stakeholders responsible for production.  Benchmarking research: Usability specialist compare      competitor applications or products and analyze which aspects are better      or worse.  Expert Review: Expect usability problems in advance      while trying an application or reviewing UX design guideline documents as      a usability specialist.  Various Qualitative Research and Quantitative Research:      Perform various qualitative research and quantitative research in order to      solve UX problems or to find out unmet needs from users.  Tech savvy, early adapter in learning or using latest      and greatest tech products, smart phones / smart watches, IOT products      with a keen interest in these technologies.  ', 'A usability specialist, also called a usability analyst or UX researcher, ensures that products including software application meet the usability and user needs requirements. In many cases, a person in this field also works to ensure that products are enjoyable to consumers. They interview and research what user’s needs and analyze user’s data. They contribute to improve usability and satisfaction of our mobile products. ['', ' User Research Before designing UX concept, usability specialist does research what users need, what pain points are, and what users like to have. Usability specialist interview, ask questions, or observe users to get insights on the needs. They also research current product and industry trends to make recommendations. Usability Testing While or after engineers develop a prototype or an application of a product, the usability specialist organizes Usability Testing of the product by users, observes the tests and asks participants detailed questions. After testing, usability specialist analyze the result analyzes the results of the testing and prepares a report of their recommendations, giving the report to the engineers, UX designers, and stakeholders responsible for production. Benchmarking research Usability specialist compare competitor applications or products and analyze which aspects are better or worse. Expert Review Expect usability problems in advance while trying an application or reviewing UX design guideline documents as a usability specialist. Various Qualitative Research and Quantitative Research Perform various qualitative research and quantitative research in order to solve UX problems or to find out unmet needs from users. ['', 'Provide mentorship and guidance to other data analysts/scientists where necessary', 'About You', 'Solid understanding of current data science best practices and technology stacks', ' Outline pragmatic solutions to answering insight needs with an eye toward balancing quantitative rigor, data incompleteness, and timelines conducive to rudimentary vs. sophisticated methods Provide input to Product and Engineering teams on cross-format planning & measurement analysis requirements and possible solution paths ', 'Hands-on fluency in data extraction, manipulation, and visualization tools such as SQL, Hive/ Impala/ Redshift/ BigQuery, Excel, Tableau, and/or others with minimal supervision', 'Product development and/or extensive client service experience with omni-channel campaign measurement systems', 'LiveRamp is currently ramping up its Safe Haven business in the U.S. and is in need of skilled data scientists who can tell our customers a story with their data. You’ll work directly with our largest and most complex clients’ datasets and data teams to help them derive value from the newly unlocked potential that Safe Haven provides them. In this capacity you will work with vast amounts of data ranging from retail transaction data to online exposure data and you’ll help our customers see the trends and paint a picture of what it all means.', 'Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.', 'Critical thinking – capable of generating consistently accurate, useful reports as well as enthusiasm for translating data into actionable insight relevant to marketing program objectives', 'Understanding of LiveRamp’s role in the market and the broader AdTech/MarTech space', 'Regularly work with the internal data science teams in engineering to provide input to the data science product roadmap and bring the knowledge of upcoming advances in our identity and products into data science', 'Build and foster positive reputation with client-facing delivery teams and Product & Engineering teams to successfully collaborate on designing, building, and launching analytical solutions', ' People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do. Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck. Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues.  Work/Life Harmony. Flexible paid time off, remote work opportunities, and paid parental leave.  Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. Whole Health Package. Medical, dental, vision and disability insurance. Plus mental health support (via Talkspace) and fitness reimbursement up to $100 per month.  Savings. Our 401K matching plan helps you plan ahead. Commuter Subsidy. $75 per month to be used toward commuter cards, monthly parking, rideshare pools, or metro/bus passes. Location. Work in the heart of New York City. ', 'Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate (both in writing and verbally) complex concepts to marketing and business audiences', 'More About Us', 'People. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, LiveRamp employees or any other company location. LiveRamp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.', 'Data privacy/security and related governance processes (Privacy Impact Assessment, CCPA, GDPR, etc)', 'Stock. FUN PARTIES & PERKS - Fun perks are a staple at Applied, including holiday parties with games and contests, summer celebrations employee appreciation events, art contests, employee discount programs, and more!   OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT - We are a growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”. Applied believes in growing our employees and promoting from within, offering many opportunities for professional advancement along the way!   CAREER STABILITY & LONGEVITY - Our average employee tenure is 9 years.   CULTURE OF RECOGNITION - Applied provides a culture of employee recognition with our Circle of Excellence program, and our internal social network recognition program.   APPLIED CARES - We have a culture that embraces and promotes volunteerism. Applied encourages our employees to help local charities and communities through the ‘Applied Cares’ program ', ' FUN PARTIES & PERKS ', ' OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT ', ' BENEFITS FROM DAY ONE ', ' APPLIED CARES ']

['', 'Participate in Agile ceremonies like standup , grooming and retrospectivesDesign and develop solutions , which includes Preparation of design documents , unit testing , code version control and other relevant operational duties.Manage data related requests, analyze issues and provide efficient resolution Design all program specifications and perform required tests.Prepare codes for all modules according to require specification.Monitor all production issues and inquiries and provide efficient resolutionEvaluate all functional requirements and map documents and perform troubleshoot on all development processes.', 'About Cognizant', 'Participate in Agile ceremonies like standup , grooming and retrospectives', 'Manage data related requests, analyze issues and provide efficient resolution Design all program specifications and perform required tests.', 'Practice - AIA - Artificial Intelligence and Analytics', 'Monitor all production issues and inquiries and provide efficient resolution', "Please note, this role is not able to offer visa transfer or sponsorship now or in the future*Practice - AIA - Artificial Intelligence and AnalyticsAbout AI & Analytics: Artificial intelligence (AI) and the data it collects and analyzes will soon sit at the core of all intelligent, human-centric businesses. By decoding customer needs, preferences, and behaviors, our clients can understand exactly what services, products, and experiences their consumers need. Within AI & Analytics, we work to design the future—a future in which trial-and-error business decisions have been replaced by informed choices and data-supported strategies.By applying AI and data science, we help leading companies to prototype, refine, validate, and scale their AI and analytics products and delivery models. Cognizant’s AIA practice takes insights that are buried in data, and provides businesses a clear way to transform how they source, interpret and consume their information. Our clients need flexible data structures and a streamlined data architecture that quickly turns data resources into informative, meaningful intelligence.Roles and ResponsibilitiesData Engineer is responsible for creating and supporting data processing solutions in cloud for our clients. In this role you will use Open Source technologies like Spark , Scala/Python/Java in AWS cloud environment to design and develop data processing applications to provide our clients with faster insight into their business. You will develop, test and deploy the solutions for warehousing systems. In addition, you will be responsible for resolving any issues with the systems as well as creating technical documentation outlining the design, troubleshooting and repair steps.Job RequirementsParticipate in Agile ceremonies like standup , grooming and retrospectivesDesign and develop solutions , which includes Preparation of design documents , unit testing , code version control and other relevant operational duties.Manage data related requests, analyze issues and provide efficient resolution Design all program specifications and perform required tests.Prepare codes for all modules according to require specification.Monitor all production issues and inquiries and provide efficient resolutionEvaluate all functional requirements and map documents and perform troubleshoot on all development processes.Collaborate with application groups to prepare effective solutions for all programs.Documents all technical specifications and associate project deliverables.Employee Status : Full Time EmployeeShift : Day JobTravel : NoJob Posting : Dec 03 2020About CognizantCognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.", 'Design and develop solutions , which includes Preparation of design documents , unit testing , code version control and other relevant operational duties.', 'Evaluate all functional requirements and map documents and perform troubleshoot on all development processes.', 'Prepare codes for all modules according to require specification.']

['', 'Bachelor’s degree from a computer science, computer engineering or related area requiredAt least three years of corporate experience designing and building production-level data processing applications requiredAt least five years of experience developing in Python requiredKnowledge of open-source statistical programming language (e.g., R, Stan) a plusKnowledge of cloud (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) a plusU.S. citizenship required', 'As a data engineer at Gallup, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities include consulting with data scientists and client teams to develop and implement high-quality, easily understood data prototypes and products they will use to advise on quantitative research across a wide range of organizational topics. You will also work with internal teams to: build infrastructure; design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable data management systems; and integrate new data management technologies and software engineering tools into existing structures. You will also partner with client teams to develop data pipelines that support a range of enterprise and government projects, including supervised and unsupervised learning methods, time-series forecasting, and network analysis.', 'What you need:', 'Strategic thinkers who collaborate with teams to help develop technical solutions', '\xa0', 'At least five years of experience developing in Python required', 'A robust benefits package including medical, dental and vision insurance options, a 401(k) retirement and savings plan with company matching, and an employee stock ownership program', 'Experienced coders', 'Automation architects who can conceptualize manual processes and generate coding and systems to reduce human dependency', 'Strategic thinkers', 'Gallup is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that celebrates, supports and promotes diversity and inclusion. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law', 'Automation architects', 'Knowledge of cloud (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) a plus', 'The creative and innovative feel of a startup with the stability and credibility of a well-established brand', 'Mission-driven individuals', 'Automation architects who can conceptualize manual processes and generate coding and systems to reduce human dependencyExperienced coders who can identify the right tools for the job and who have an eye for the smallest details and a talent for flawless executionStrategic thinkers who collaborate with teams to help develop technical solutionsProblem solvers who enjoy working with others to design and implement robust solutions to challenging real-world problemsCreative analysts who are familiar with a variety of coding languages, enjoy participating in (and winning!) hackathons, and have experience working across programming languages and systems to meet the needs of multiple stakeholdersMission-driven individuals motivated to create the best production, prototype and research infrastructures because of their desire to change the world', 'Bachelor’s degree from a computer science, computer engineering or related area required', 'At least three years of corporate experience designing and building production-level data processing applications required', 'And the benefits don’t stop there. For more information about the perks of working in our Omaha Riverfront, please visit:\xa0https://www.gallup.com/careers/308483/omaha-riverfront.aspx', 'Experienced coders who can identify the right tools for the job and who have an eye for the smallest details and a talent for flawless execution', 'U.S. citizenship required', 'Mission-driven individuals motivated to create the best production, prototype and research infrastructures because of their desire to change the world', 'Creative analysts', 'Problem solvers who enjoy working with others to design and implement robust solutions to challenging real-world problems', 'Creative analysts who are familiar with a variety of coding languages, enjoy participating in (and winning!) hackathons, and have experience working across programming languages and systems to meet the needs of multiple stakeholders', 'Problem solvers', 'Who we want:', 'World-class managers who guide and empower associates based on their unique skills and strengths', 'Continuous learning and development opportunities to work with the latest technology', 'Continuous learning and development opportunities to work with the latest technologyThe creative and innovative feel of a startup with the stability and credibility of a well-established brandWorld-class managers who guide and empower associates based on their unique skills and strengthsA robust benefits package including medical, dental and vision insurance options, a 401(k) retirement and savings plan with company matching, and an employee stock ownership programA beautiful downtown office on the Missouri River that boasts 50 acres of land', 'What we offer:', 'Knowledge of open-source statistical programming language (e.g., R, Stan) a plus', 'A beautiful downtown office on the Missouri River that boasts 50 acres of land', 'Make a difference. ['', 'Knowledge of Git.', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills.', 'Strong knowledge of Python for data science.', 'Create well-organized datasets and analyses for our dog products that span multiple business lines and dog demographics.', 'Strong knowledge of statistical inference, experiment design, probability, sampling methodologies, regression, classification, clustering, data mining, time series analysis, and causal inference analysis.', ' Combine multiple data sources to create a clear and cohesive picture of our customers. Collaborate with business partners to make meaningful segments to target users based on shared preferences or behaviors. Collaborate with Planning, Sourcing, Product Design, Merchandising, Machine Learning, Customer Service, and Engineering to create meaningful and predictive feature sets for our dog products. Create well-organized datasets and analyses for our dog products that span multiple business lines and dog demographics. Work with Box, Retail, Marketplaces, Product, Eats, Bright Dental, Tech Product, Machine Learning, Customer Service, Marketing, and Licensing/Partnerships to test hypotheses, answer nuanced questions, make strategic decisions, and create efficiencies.  Use available data to size and project opportunities to improve the business or customer experience. ', 'Work with Box, Retail, Marketplaces, Product, Eats, Bright Dental, Tech Product, Machine Learning, Customer Service, Marketing, and Licensing/Partnerships to test hypotheses, answer nuanced questions, make strategic decisions, and create efficiencies. ', ' Strong knowledge of Python for data science. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. job_title: Research Scientist - Numerical Simulations & Data Science
job_text: ['', ' Strong mathematical fundamentals, including but not limited to numerical methods for multi-fidelity and multi-scale mathematical models, including Partial Differential Equations, linear algebra, optimization. ', ' Maintain and grow the existing network with academia and research community. ', '  Collaborate with the team to fulfill our vision by developing novel fast and accurate simulation approaches.   Utilize your knowledge of physics modeling, numerical solvers and AI-based acceleration techniques for evaluating existing and conceiving innovative approaches for quick performance prediction  Prototype, implement and evaluate the most promising algorithms for the numerical solution to real-world physical problems.   Build Siemens-internal network to acquire and lead research projects to advance the technology and secure innovation   Participate and lead projects with Siemens businesses, including research & development as well as technical consulting   Communicate complex ideas and testing results effectively, both orally and in writing, and provide recommendations and support to internal engineering teams through accurate and effective written documentation   Publish results in leading conferences and journals   Collaborate with others, both within and outside Siemens, to develop successful research proposals for external funding that align with Siemens strategic direction   Maintain and grow the existing network with academia and research community.   Assist developing brand recognition externally by networking with industry experts, attending conferences and partnering with universities in the US ', 'Company:', ' Communicate complex ideas and testing results effectively, both orally and in writing, and provide recommendations and support to internal engineering teams through accurate and effective written documentation ', ' Collaborate with the team to fulfill our vision by developing novel fast and accurate simulation approaches. ', ' Proven ability to conceive and develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record in top journals, successful grant proposals or other request for funding. ', ' Experience in coding in Python, R, C++ and ability to write high quality code ', 'Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision', 'Organization:', ' Publish results in leading conferences and journals ', 'California Privacy Notice', ' Utilize your knowledge of physics modeling, numerical solvers and AI-based acceleration techniques for evaluating existing and conceiving innovative approaches for quick performance prediction ', ' Prototype, implement and evaluate the most promising algorithms for the numerical solution to real-world physical problems. ', 'Experience Level:', ' Established networks within US academia/research institutions including public funded project proposal writing ', 'EEO is the Law', ' Build Siemens-internal network to acquire and lead research projects to advance the technology and secure innovation ', 'Equal Employment Opportunity Statement', 'About UsWe want to provide our customers with the best in class technology to leverage digital twins and simulation models in the easiest and most valuable way possible. Our team explores synergies between physics modeling, artificial intelligence, software development and design concepts to create the next generation tools for product design and virtual evaluations. With your help we are going to achieve our mission!Our research team is located in beautiful Princeton, NJ, a university town packed with exceptional international talent that provides a unique feel of this true cultural gem in the state. The town has plenty of activities to offer, but for those looking for more, New York City and Philadelphia are just a short hour drive away with robust public transportation available. We have the best public schools in the country and the area is glued together by a very active and welcoming community.As Siemens’ central Research & Development department, we embrace this community. Our core mission is to support our Siemens business units as a central knowledge hub for all cybersecurity capabilities globally. We research and develop new and innovative solutions, based on much-needed deep technical expertise, and our network with internal and external experts and academia. This allows us to invent new solutions and approaches and verify their feasibility in the “real world” together with the product development teams of our business units – creating a stimulating setup for quick innovation cycles and rapid prototyping.We also offer a generous remote working environment as well as robust health and wellness benefits to promote healthy living and support the best lifestyle for you and your family.Organization: TechnologyCompany: Siemens CorporationExperience Level: Early ProfessionalJob Type: Full-timeEqual Employment Opportunity StatementSiemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.EEO is the LawApplicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here .Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination ProvisionSiemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here .California Privacy NoticeCalifornia residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here .Equal Employment Opportunity StatementSiemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, protected veteran or military status, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.EEO is the Law Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination ProvisionSiemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.', ' Familiarity with existing real-time physics solver approaches. Research and development of novel real-time physics solvers is a plus. ', 'The Candidate', 'EEO is the Law ', ' Research Scientists must have a PhD in engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or equivalent, with 2+ years of related experience. Staff Research Scientists must have a PhD with 6+ years of related experience. ', ' Experience in implementing numerical solvers for the solution of large problems with parallel programming on CPU and GPU computer architectures. ', ' Assist developing brand recognition externally by networking with industry experts, attending conferences and partnering with universities in the US', ' Familiarity with AI/ML tools and packages like pyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Weka, Caffe, et al ', 'Job Type:', 'About Us', '  Research Scientists must have a PhD in engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or equivalent, with 2+ years of related experience. Staff Research Scientists must have a PhD with 6+ years of related experience.   Strong mathematical fundamentals, including but not limited to numerical methods for multi-fidelity and multi-scale mathematical models, including Partial Differential Equations, linear algebra, optimization.   Familiarity with existing real-time physics solver approaches. Research and development of novel real-time physics solvers is a plus.   Strong background in Machine Learning, with Graduate research and internship experience in the field, and deep understanding of the algorithms.   Experience in implementing numerical solvers for the solution of large problems with parallel programming on CPU and GPU computer architectures.   Experience in coding in Python, R, C++ and ability to write high quality code   Familiarity with AI/ML tools and packages like pyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Weka, Caffe, et al   Proven ability to conceive and develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record in top journals, successful grant proposals or other request for funding.   Established networks within US academia/research institutions including public funded project proposal writing   Good communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem solving, good time management and task prioritization skills, with motivation to learn and use new technologies, work under uncertainty at fast pace, and ability to multitask and make key contributions to several projects  ', ' Strong background in Machine Learning, with Graduate research and internship experience in the field, and deep understanding of the algorithms. ', 'The Challenge', ' Collaborate with others, both within and outside Siemens, to develop successful research proposals for external funding that align with Siemens strategic direction ', ' Good communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem solving, good time management and task prioritization skills, with motivation to learn and use new technologies, work under uncertainty at fast pace, and ability to multitask and make key contributions to several projects ', ' Participate and lead projects with Siemens businesses, including research & development as well as technical consulting ']

['', 'Use R/Python and a modern data science stack (Gitlab, Docker, AWS) to ensure that data products are reproducible, extensible, and easily integrated into the IXIS software platform', 'Design innovative quantitative solutions to client/industry challenges, and manage team resources to ensure that project work is delegated appropriately', 'Lead by example: Foster a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continual improvement among the data science team', '\xa0', 'Collaborate effectively across teams and departments, including software/QA engineers, strategists, designers, and qualitative researchers', 'Ability to work well with a team and on a deadline', 'Experience with digital analytics (such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics) and e-commerce/marketing fundamentals', 'B.A./B.S. in Computer Science; or B.A./B.S. in a quantitative area (such as Statistics, Applied Math, Data Science or Economics) with a minor (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science; post-graduate degree preferred (commensurate professional experience will be considered)', 'Lead requirements gathering for quantitative projects, oversee technical documentation, and communicate findings to non-technical audiences, including executive-level presentations', 'B.A./B.S. in Computer Science; or B.A./B.S. in a quantitative area (such as Statistics, Applied Math, Data Science or Economics) with a minor (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science; post-graduate degree preferred (commensurate professional experience will be considered)3+ years’ professional experience with programmatic data analysis and visualization using R/Python and industry-standard data science libraries (tidyverse, data.table, NumPy, Pandas); must be adept at functional programming and love writing clean code – exposure to DevOps (CICD) practices a plusExperience working with data in the wild, including structured and unstructured data, record linkage/householding, data cleaning/reshaping, descriptive data analysis, and exploratory data visualizationExperience developing and deploying machine learning pipelines with demonstrated predictive accuracyUncompromising attention to detail, critical thinking skills, and a systematic and creative approach to problem-solving, with strong data intuitionAbility to work well with a team and on a deadline', 'Formal training in research design (experimental and non-experimental methodologies) and statistical testing, including classical significance tests, linear models, survival analysis, and timeseries', 'Required Skills and Experience', 'Experience developing and deploying machine learning pipelines with demonstrated predictive accuracy', 'IXIS is seeking an energetic and innovative quantitative researcher with expertise in classical statistics and modern predictive modeling and a proven ability to deliver data science projects to fill the position of Senior Data Scientist for the company. The core responsibilities for this role include leading the design of sophisticated quantitative solutions—frequently through integration of novel data sources—and executing these solutions programmatically/reproducibly within a team environment. The Senior Data Scientist must be able to provide realistic estimates for hours and timelines needed to produce deliverables. The ideal candidate will combine deep technical expertise in programmatic statistical analysis and predictive modeling (using R or Python) with strong critical thinking skills and “data IQ” to translate client questions into quantitative approaches that produce actionable insights. This is a full-time, onsite position in our Burlington, Vermont office (note: remote work is currently practiced due to COVID-19 social distancing).', 'Prioritize multiple tasks intelligently and maintain clear lines of communication with supervisor, team, and clients', 'Formal training in research design (experimental and non-experimental methodologies) and statistical testing, including classical significance tests, linear models, survival analysis, and timeseriesExperience with digital analytics (such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics) and e-commerce/marketing fundamentals', '3+ years’ professional experience with programmatic data analysis and visualization using R/Python and industry-standard data science libraries (tidyverse, data.table, NumPy, Pandas); must be adept at functional programming and love writing clean code – exposure to DevOps (CICD) practices a plus', 'Overview', 'Responsibilities', 'Experience working with data in the wild, including structured and unstructured data, record linkage/householding, data cleaning/reshaping, descriptive data analysis, and exploratory data visualization', 'Design innovative quantitative solutions to client/industry challenges, and manage team resources to ensure that project work is delegated appropriatelyUse R/Python and a modern data science stack (Gitlab, Docker, AWS) to ensure that data products are reproducible, extensible, and easily integrated into the IXIS software platformLead by example: Foster a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continual improvement among the data science teamWork with data engineers to plan, implement, and automate integration of disparate data sources across a variety of architectures, and help oversee data security and data governance initiativesLead requirements gathering for quantitative projects, oversee technical documentation, and communicate findings to non-technical audiences, including executive-level presentationsCollaborate effectively across teams and departments, including software/QA engineers, strategists, designers, and qualitative researchersPrioritize multiple tasks intelligently and maintain clear lines of communication with supervisor, team, and clients', 'Work with data engineers to plan, implement, and automate integration of disparate data sources across a variety of architectures, and help oversee data security and data governance initiatives', 'Desired Skills and Experience', 'Uncompromising attention to detail, critical thinking skills, and a systematic and creative approach to problem-solving, with strong data intuition']

['', 'Data Scientist (Python, Machine Learning) – Perm – Raleigh, NC', 'You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the Information Technology industry and market trends . Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there’s a position you really want, you’re fully prepared to get it.', 'The Data Scientist will report to the Senior Manager, Data Science and provides analytical cross-functional support through effective use of predictive analytics and forecasting methods to improve operational visibility and efficiencies. This Raleigh-based position will support cross-functional as well as cross-platform (including international) advanced modeling and promote best practices.', '• Machine Learning with python and ability to project manage', '• Evolve and advance customer behavioral segmentation models, building marketing, sales and product predicative models, analyzing results and movements of segments/clusters and providing business insights to grow the company’s market share and revenue', 'Visit the Hays Career Advice section to learn top tips to help you stand out from the crowd when job hunting.', 'Role Description', 'Nervous about an upcoming interview? Unsure how to write a new resume?', '• Masters Degree (variety of areas of focus are fine, listed in JD)', 'The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.', 'The Data Scientist is part of a highly analytical team that provides business critical intelligence and advice for decision support. In this role, you will collaborate with partners in operations (underwriting, claims), marketing, products and customer experience, pricing, risk and other functions to define problems, identify data, build reports and dashboards, establish predictive and prescriptive models, and deliver optimal solutions across the entire range across the line of business and customers.', '• Develop supervised (regression and classification) and unsupervised (e.g. clustering and segmentation) models', '• Provide mentorship and share knowledge with functional and cross-functional peers', 'Hays is an Equal Opportunity Employer.', '• Cloud experience- definitely prefer AWS since they are migrating to AWS', '• Partner with IT and Enterprise Data Management Organization (EDMO) teams on the evaluation of data assets and their proper use', '• Research current processes and proactively identify emerging needs for analytic models', '• Experience with Big Data/Messy Data', 'Skills & Requirements', 'Why Hays?', 'Drug testing may be required; please contact a recruiter for more information.', '• 2-3+ years experience of work in this space, with multiple ML: projects worked on and/or delivered', '• Design, create and implement advanced analytics and forecasting models to optimize business processes. Provide insights for decision making through the use of ML, and traditional statistical modeling', 'A Financial Company is seeking a Data Scientist (Python, Machine Learning) in Raleigh, NC.']

['Clinical', '\xa0Research Scientist (Social Work) ', 'EDUCATION:Must possess a Ph.D. in Social Work with an emphasis on data, evaluation, and research.EXPERIENCE:\uf0b7 Must have demonstrated an active portfolio of funded research and leadership in the field.\uf0b7 Must have at least five (5) years’ experience conducting research and publishing in a peerreviewed journal.\uf0b7 Must have at least one year of Supervisory or Management experience.', 'The Ph.D level Clinical\xa0Research Scientist (Social Work) at the Center for Child and Family Traumatic Stress (CCFTS) will support leadership through a research agenda and projects focused on individuals, children, and families. This published Ph.D Social Work Researcher will focus on traumatic stress, impact of race, mental health disparities within a multicultural context, and the promotion of social justice. The incumbent will work with federal and state grant funded research/projects and be a part of the department’s clinical practice with communities of color or other minorities. In coordination with the Vice President, Research Director, and key CCFTS leadership this position will assist with research direction. The Clinical Research Scientist may also have administrative and clinical care duties as assigned. ', 'Ph.D level ']

', 'Healthy meals and snacks provided', ' MA/MS/PhD, human behavior related field (HCI, Psychology, Computer Science, or Information Science, Economics, Political Science, etc) 5+ years experience conducting research related to highly interactive software, web applications and web information architecture Track record of using foundational, formative, and evaluative research methods such as: usability studies (remote/in lab), card sorting, user task analysis, log analysis, interviews, surveys, moderating group conversations, testing of early designs and prototypes, basic quantitative analyses, A/B testing Experience working with large-scale data in multi-method studies Ability to work independently with little direct supervision and take initiative to solve problems Experience leading research projects that have had lasting impact on product and design decisions. ['', 'Identify, synthesize, and translate findings into insights and communicate recommendations to leadership to influence product improvements.', 'Chorus Innovations is a fast-growing healthcare technology company with a no-code PaaS that enables anyone to visually create mobile, text messaging and interactive voice apps. Chorus’ unique and powerful platform is currently being used by doctors, researchers, patients and community stakeholders alike to power transformative healthcare, biomedical research and community improvement projects across dozens of institutions and public health agencies worldwide.', 'Compensation and Benefits', 'Full benefits', 'As a\xa0UX Researcher, you make an impact by identifying and communicating what users need from apps created with Chorus. You will collaborate with UX/UI Designers, Product Managers, Community Engagement Specialists, and Developers to improve our digital products by planning user research activities and exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users.', '\u200d', '\xa0', 'Knowledge of\xa0qualitative and quantitative research methodologies, including: usability testing, contextual inquiries, card sorts, journey maps, surveys, persona development, task analysis, etc.', 'You will present your research findings, insights, and recommendations to leadership to influence product improvements. Impact the lives of healthcare professionals and users by helping us create effective, efficient, engaging, and intuitive experiences.', 'Truly mission driven company: help improve the lives of others by democratizing health tech development!', 'Experience specifically around participatory design, emotional design, and human-centered design methods is a definite plus.', 'Bachelor’s degree required (preferred branches of psychology, anthropology, human factors, human computer interaction, or related field).Experience specifically around participatory design, emotional design, and human-centered design methods is a definite plus.Experience performing user research activities, including: planning research, recruiting participants, moderating, synthesizing research results, creating reports, and presenting results.Knowledge of\xa0qualitative and quantitative research methodologies, including: usability testing, contextual inquiries, card sorts, journey maps, surveys, persona development, task analysis, etc.Understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply the methods in order to provide the strongest insights for a given project.Experience working collaboratively and effectively with others.Familiarity with following research tools or comparable tools: Maze.Design, UserTesting.com, User Zoom, and WebEx.Strong verbal and written communications skills coupled with high attention to detail.', 'UX Researcher', 'Contribute to the continuous improvement of user research processes and best practices. Actively participate in team discussions and fulfill commitments that contribute to the team’s overall success. Promote best practices to ensure we are collecting high quality results across the organization.', '\u200dAre you ready to influence the development of a digital health platform\xa0by conducting user research with healthcare professionals and users? Come join our user research team! Learn, grow, and thrive on a team who uses innovative research methods to drive programs that deliver deep customer insights for the Chorus app development platform.', 'The team is working remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic. We will reopen our LA office after the pandemic period, although remote positions will be considered.', 'Experience working collaboratively and effectively with others.', 'Lead all user research planning activities for assigned projects, including developing screeners, recruiting qualified participants, translating research goals into research questions and an appropriate test plan, and communicating with stakeholders.', 'Strong verbal and written communications skills coupled with high attention to detail.', 'Understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply the methods in order to provide the strongest insights for a given project.', 'Bachelor’s degree required (preferred branches of psychology, anthropology, human factors, human computer interaction, or related field).', 'Familiarity with following research tools or comparable tools: Maze.Design, UserTesting.com, User Zoom, and WebEx.', 'Conduct usability tests, contextual inquiries, focus groups, surveys and other qualitative and quantitative user research studies to gain a better understanding of our users and identify opportunities to improve the user experience. Deliver results by predetermined deadlines within the scope of the project.Lead all user research planning activities for assigned projects, including developing screeners, recruiting qualified participants, translating research goals into research questions and an appropriate test plan, and communicating with stakeholders.Identify, synthesize, and translate findings into insights and communicate recommendations to leadership to influence product improvements.Build and maintain product and persona knowledge of Chorus customers in order to conduct more thorough user research, including staying up to date on user research activities across the organization.Contribute to the continuous improvement of user research processes and best practices. Actively participate in team discussions and fulfill commitments that contribute to the team’s overall success. Promote best practices to ensure we are collecting high quality results across the organization.', 'Truly mission driven company: help improve the lives of others by democratizing health tech development!Stock OptionsFull benefits', 'Build the future!', 'Experience performing user research activities, including: planning research, recruiting participants, moderating, synthesizing research results, creating reports, and presenting results.', 'Stock Options', 'Build and maintain product and persona knowledge of Chorus customers in order to conduct more thorough user research, including staying up to date on user research activities across the organization.', 'What can you bring to the role?', 'How can you make an Impact?', 'What can you expect from the position?', 'Conduct usability tests, contextual inquiries, focus groups, surveys and other qualitative and quantitative user research studies to gain a better understanding of our users and identify opportunities to improve the user experience. Deliver results by predetermined deadlines within the scope of the project.']

job_title: Sr. Data Engineer (AWS, Python, Airflow & R), Data Science Products (open to remote)
job_text: ['', ' Demonstrated ability to collaborate with all levels of data science engineering technology personnel and senior leadership. ', 'Your Competencies', ' Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, software engineers, business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders to implement data science engineering solutions based on business priorities and technology initiatives. ', ' Hands-on experience in the latest breed of software, automation and CICD technologies including Python, SQL, Airflow and Git in a cloud setting. Experience with R is preferred. ', ' 3+ years professional experience as a cloud data engineer, data scientist or related role. ', ' Solve complex business questions where situations or data require in-depth evaluation of variable factors. ', ' Power smarter treatments and healthier people with innovative data analytic applications.  Develop advanced cloud (AWS) based data systems to extract, assess, integrate, transform, clean, analyze and visualize datasets for complex analytics and statistical modeling.  Create automated data flows for research and production settings with data science engineering best practices, transparency, and scalability.  Solve complex business questions where situations or data require in-depth evaluation of variable factors.  Assess analytical data sources, conduct hands-on exploration to determine their value, and make them available enterprise-wide.  Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, software engineers, business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders to implement data science engineering solutions based on business priorities and technology initiatives. ', ' Undergraduate degree in a technical or engineering field, such as Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science or Software Engineering. Masters degree is a plus. ', ' Create automated data flows for research and production settings with data science engineering best practices, transparency, and scalability. ', ' Entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to creating rigorous, high-quality insights from data, at scale. ', ' Advanced skills in modern data architecture, data science engineering, data transformation, data modeling and manipulation of structured and unstructured data sources using state-of-art cloud computing technologies (AWS). ', ' Clear, concise communication abilities – writing, verbal, presentation – to all levels of technical and non-technical audiences. ', ' Familiarity with Big Data processing and distributed database technologies including Spark and NoSQL. ', ' Power smarter treatments and healthier people with innovative data analytic applications. ', 'Your Mission', ' Undergraduate degree in a technical or engineering field, such as Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science or Software Engineering. Masters degree is a plus.  3+ years professional experience as a cloud data engineer, data scientist or related role.  Experience with clinical trial data is not required, but interest to learn and understand how these data drive medical research is paramount. ', 'Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.', ' Assess analytical data sources, conduct hands-on exploration to determine their value, and make them available enterprise-wide. ', ' Experience with clinical trial data is not required, but interest to learn and understand how these data drive medical research is paramount. ', ' Advanced skills in modern data architecture, data science engineering, data transformation, data modeling and manipulation of structured and unstructured data sources using state-of-art cloud computing technologies (AWS).  Hands-on experience in the latest breed of software, automation and CICD technologies including Python, SQL, Airflow and Git in a cloud setting. Experience with R is preferred.  Familiarity with Big Data processing and distributed database technologies including Spark and NoSQL.  Demonstrated ability to collaborate with all levels of data science engineering technology personnel and senior leadership.  Clear, concise communication abilities – writing, verbal, presentation – to all levels of technical and non-technical audiences.  Entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to creating rigorous, high-quality insights from data, at scale. ', ' Develop advanced cloud (AWS) based data systems to extract, assess, integrate, transform, clean, analyze and visualize datasets for complex analytics and statistical modeling. ', 'Your Education & Experience']

['Continuing to define our key personas and identify opportunities to make our offerings more attractive and helpful for them.', 'Responsibilities Include', 'Conducting quantitative and qualitative research into our markets around the world, including user analyses, company analysis, and competitive analysis.', 'A storyteller with the ability to influence business decisions.', 'Demonstrated ability to forge strong relationships across an organization to align insights to each line of business and ensure research projects meet present and future business needs.', '3+ years of experience conducting market research.', 'SketchUp is one of the most popular 3D modeling and design tools in the world. Today, hundreds of thousands of architects, engineers, contractors, woodworkers, artists, and other creatives use SketchUp Pro, LayOut and the 3D Warehouse to design everything from transit centers to treehouses and everything in between.', 'To make sure we continue to delight our customers, it’s essential that we continue to learn about them, understand their needs and build exciting and innovative solutions for them. This is a moving target: customer’s needs change, markets evolve, new technologies come along, and the competitive landscape changes.', 'About SketchUp', 'About The Opportunity', 'Bachelor’s in Marketing, Psychology, Social Science, or a related field / A Master’s Degree is preferred.3+ years of experience conducting market research.Market research, consumer insights, or related experience in client-side companies with a strong consumer focus.A strong business acumen and analytical, decision-making, and presentation skills.A storyteller with the ability to influence business decisions.An independent, strategic, and creative thinker who is a strong team player.Ability to think both analytically and creatively—balance left and right brain—people person as well as data person.Proficient in methodological design (including approach, protocol, survey/questionnaire, and output/deliverables).Demonstrated ability to forge strong relationships across an organization to align insights to each line of business and ensure research projects meet present and future business needs.', 'Identifying whitespace, emerging trends, and areas in decline.', 'Ability to think both analytically and creatively—balance left and right brain—people person as well as data person.', 'Product and consumer research in the technology space.', 'Experience conducting market research for SaaS companies.', 'Helping the team develop product positioning that differentiates our offerings.', 'Bachelor’s in Marketing, Psychology, Social Science, or a related field / A Master’s Degree is preferred.', 'Conducting quantitative and qualitative research into our markets around the world, including user analyses, company analysis, and competitive analysis.Identifying whitespace, emerging trends, and areas in decline.Making product/feature, marketing messages and go to market recommendations based on market trends and demands.Helping the team develop product positioning that differentiates our offerings.Continuing to define our key personas and identify opportunities to make our offerings more attractive and helpful for them.', 'The Market Researcher role is focused on understanding how markets are evolving. Working closely with marketing, product management, and sales, you will help the Architecture and Design (AKA “SketchUp”) team better understand our markets around the world. ', 'Experience with SketchUp.', 'Preferred Skills', 'An independent, strategic, and creative thinker who is a strong team player.', 'The successful candidate will have experience discovering, understanding and communicating market opportunities and therefore have a substantial impact on the Architecture & Design strategy, products and go to market execution. ', 'Market research, consumer insights, or related experience in client-side companies with a strong consumer focus.', 'Experience with Agile workflows.Experience with SketchUp.Experience conducting market research for SaaS companies.Product and consumer research in the technology space.', 'Required Skills', 'Proficient in methodological design (including approach, protocol, survey/questionnaire, and output/deliverables).', 'Making product/feature, marketing messages and go to market recommendations based on market trends and demands.', 'Experience with Agile workflows.', "In addition to a resume, please submit an example of a marketing campaign you've worked on, and include what its main goals/KPIs were. Cover letters are optional, but we’d love to hear a little about why you’re interested in this position.", 'A strong business acumen and analytical, decision-making, and presentation skills.']

job_title: Big Data Engineer (Hadoop, Kafka Streaming, SQL)
job_text: ['Designing, develop & tune data products, applications and integrations on large scale data platforms (Hadoop, Kafka Streaming, Hana, SQL server etc) with an emphasis on performance, reliability and scalability and most of all quality. ', 'Experience in development methodologies like Agile / Scrum', 'Strong Experience with Hadoop ETL/ Data Ingestion: Sqoop, Flume, Hive, Spark, Hbase', 'Strong SQL, ETL, scripting and or programming skills with a preference towards Python, Java, Scala, shell scripting', 'Strong experience on SQL and PLSQL ', 'Familiarity with streaming applications', 'MS/BS in Computer Science / related technical field with 4+ years of strong hands-on experience in enterprise data warehousing / big data implementations & complex data solutions and frameworks', ' Familiarity with streaming applications Experience in development methodologies like Agile / Scrum Strong Experience with Hadoop ETL/ Data Ingestion: Sqoop, Flume, Hive, Spark, Hbase Strong experience on SQL and PLSQL  Nice to have experience in Real Time Data Ingestion using Kafka, Storm, Spark or Complex Event Processing Experience in Hadoop Data Consumption and Other Components: Hive, Hue HBase, , Spark, Pig, Impala, Presto', 'Experience in Hadoop Data Consumption and Other Components: Hive, Hue HBase, , Spark, Pig, Impala, Presto', "Collaborate with key stakeholders including business team, engineering leads, architects, BSA's & program managers.
