job_title: Staff or Senior Machine Learning Scientist
job_text: ['', 'About You', 'Excellent understanding of Machine Learning/Deep Learning, statistical modeling and time-series analysis.', 'Passion for materializing ideas that impact the lives of patients.', 'Ability to motivate others and provide focus on large collaborative and challenging goals and deadlines.', 'Additional Desired/preferred Qualifications Include', 'Demonstrated ability to interact with, and exert significant influence on internal/external collaborators on research/development objectives, methods, and results’ interpretation', 'MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics or a related quantitative field.', 'About IRhythm', 'Familiarity with cloud computing and big data technologies', 'What’s In It For You', 'Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with python libraries like numpy, scikit-learn, pandas etc.', 'Effective presentation and interpersonal skills.', 'Participate in the design, development and maintenance of the Deep Learning infrastructure that fuels iRhythm’s insights generation engine', 'Experience developing software in a Unix/Linux programming environment', 'As a part of our core values, we ensure a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome and celebrate people of all backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. iRhythm Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D). Pursuant to San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.', 'Work closely with our software/firmware engineering teams and clinical experts to transition algorithms developed into production.', 'FLSA Status', 'Experience with deep neural network architectures and software frameworks like TensorFlow.', 'Responsibilities', 'Experience working with large data sets and excellent knowledge of database languages (such as SQL)', 'Present research findings to internal stakeholders, iRhythm leadership, as well as at industry conferences.', ' Previous research experience with biomedical data Experience developing software in a Unix/Linux programming environment Familiarity with cloud computing and big data technologies ', 'Strong understanding of signal processing concepts (Filtering, Fourier, and Wavelet transforms).', 'About This Role', ' Design, build and test machine learning algorithms for the analysis of biosignal data from a variety of data sources, including wearables (e.g. ECG, PPG, accelerometry) and simulation of efficient signal transmissions over IoT devices. Identify and apply advanced machine learning and statistical methods in both exploratory and confirmatory data analysis of multivariate clinical data sets, electronic health and claims records. Participate in the design, development and maintenance of the Deep Learning infrastructure that fuels iRhythm’s insights generation engine Work closely with our software/firmware engineering teams and clinical experts to transition algorithms developed into production. Present research findings to internal stakeholders, iRhythm leadership, as well as at industry conferences. ', ' Excellent understanding of Machine Learning/Deep Learning, statistical modeling and time-series analysis. Strong understanding of signal processing concepts (Filtering, Fourier, and Wavelet transforms). Experience with deep neural network architectures and software frameworks like TensorFlow. Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with python libraries like numpy, scikit-learn, pandas etc. Experience working with large data sets and excellent knowledge of database languages (such as SQL) Passion for materializing ideas that impact the lives of patients. Effective presentation and interpersonal skills. Ability to motivate others and provide focus on large collaborative and challenging goals and deadlines. Demonstrated ability to interact with, and exert significant influence on internal/external collaborators on research/development objectives, methods, and results’ interpretation MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics or a related quantitative field. ', 'Identify and apply advanced machine learning and statistical methods in both exploratory and confirmatory data analysis of multivariate clinical data sets, electronic health and claims records.', 'Previous research experience with biomedical data', 'Design, build and test machine learning algorithms for the analysis of biosignal data from a variety of data sources, including wearables (e.g. ECG, PPG, accelerometry) and simulation of efficient signal transmissions over IoT devices.']

The Company focuses on\xa0providing\xa0laboratory equipment, chemicals,\xa0supplies,\xa0and services used in healthcare, scientific research, safety, and education.\xa0\xa0', 'The Client is seeking an experienced candidate to support lab automation and validation throughout manufacturing.\xa0', 'Overview:\xa0', 'Provide technical support to enhance manufacturing robustness and repeatability\xa0Support continuous improvement, new product development, and method transfers.\xa0Plan, schedule and performs testing of processes and reagents utilizing techniques such as fluorescent-based assays, qPCR,\xa0dPCR,\xa0and NGS\xa0Participate in the design and execution of method and process validations.\xa0Analyze data and communicate results in a team environment.\xa0Participate in the drafting manufacturing documentation such as production SOPs\xa0Troubleshoot issues/conduct root cause analysis and to recommend and implement corrective actions for processes\xa0Maintains accurate records and documentation; responsible for the quality of project deliverables and documentation\xa0', 'Position Summary:\xa0', 'Plan, schedule and performs testing of processes and reagents utilizing techniques such as fluorescent-based assays, qPCR,\xa0dPCR,\xa0and NGS\xa0', 'Experience with the analytical method and process validation in a regulated environment\xa0', 'Essential Functions:\xa0', 'Education /Experience Requirements\xa0', 'Work\xa0Location: Frederick, Maryland 21704\xa0', 'Analyze data and communicate results in a team environment.\xa0', 'Experience in completing documentation (GDP) and data collection in a GMP laboratory\xa0', 'Bachelor’s degree (or AS + relevant experience) in Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology or other related life science discipline in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field.\xa0']

['', 'WorldLink is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to factors including race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.\xa0People with disabilities who need assistance with any part of the application process should contact us.', 'Imagination to think of ways of improving mobile applications.', 'Benchmarking research: Usability specialist compare competitor applications or products and analyze which aspects are better or worse.', 'Summary', 'Need good communication and writing skills.', 'Necessary Skills / Attributes', 'Good analytical approach with experience in using Google Analytics, statistical analysis.', 'Work Location: Plano, TX (remote until office re-opens)', 'A usability specialist, also called a usability analyst or UX researcher, ensures that products including software application meet the usability and user needs requirements. In many cases, a person in this field also works to ensure that products are enjoyable to consumers. They interview and research what user’s needs and analyze user’s data. They contribute to improve usability and satisfaction of our mobile products.', 'Expert Review: Expect usability problems in advance while trying an application or reviewing UX design guideline documents as a usability specialist.', 'User Research: Before designing UX concept, usability specialist does research what users need, what pain points are, and what users like to have. Usability specialist interview, ask questions, or observe users to get insights on the needs. They also research current product and industry trends to make recommendations.', 'Usability Testing: While or after engineers develop a prototype or an application of a product, the usability specialist organizes Usability Testing of the product by users, observes the tests and asks participants detailed questions. After testing, usability specialist analyze the result analyzes the results of the testing and prepares a report of their recommendations, giving the report to the engineers, UX designers, and stakeholders responsible for production.', 'Skills to research new technologies and current trends to anticipate consumer needs.', 'Create usability testing documentation, facilitate discussions and deep dives to better understand user requirements', 'Typically need various user research and analysis skills such as interviews, usability testing, surveys, focus groups, and so onNeed good communication and writing skills.Skills to research new technologies and current trends to anticipate consumer needs.Imagination to think of ways of improving mobile applications.Create usability testing documentation, facilitate discussions and deep dives to better understand user requirementsA self-starter, driven, strong relationship builder, passionate about learning and making a differenceGood analytical approach with experience in using Google Analytics, statistical analysis.5+ years of experience in high tech industry with sound understanding of technical concepts and an opinion in User experiences on handheld devices.', 'Typically need various user research and analysis skills such as interviews, usability testing, surveys, focus groups, and so on', '5+ years of experience in high tech industry with sound understanding of technical concepts and an opinion in User experiences on handheld devices.', 'Responsibilities:', 'A self-starter, driven, strong relationship builder, passionate about learning and making a difference', 'User Research: Before designing UX concept, usability specialist does research what users need, what pain points are, and what users like to have. Usability specialist interview, ask questions, or observe users to get insights on the needs. They also research current product and industry trends to make recommendations.Usability Testing: While or after engineers develop a prototype or an application of a product, the usability specialist organizes Usability Testing of the product by users, observes the tests and asks participants detailed questions. After testing, usability specialist analyze the result analyzes the results of the testing and prepares a report of their recommendations, giving the report to the engineers, UX designers, and stakeholders responsible for production.Benchmarking research: Usability specialist compare competitor applications or products and analyze which aspects are better or worse.Expert Review: Expect usability problems in advance while trying an application or reviewing UX design guideline documents as a usability specialist.Various Qualitative Research and Quantitative Research: Perform various qualitative research and quantitative research in order to solve UX problems or to find out unmet needs from users.Tech savvy, early adapter in learning or using latest and greatest tech products, smart phones / smart watches, IOT products with a keen interest in these technologies.', 'Various Qualitative Research and Quantitative Research: Perform various qualitative research and quantitative research in order to solve UX problems or to find out unmet needs from users.', 'This job description is designed to cover the main responsibilities and duties of the role but is not designed to be a comprehensive list of all.', 'Job Title: UX Researcher', 'Tech savvy, early adapter in learning or using latest and greatest tech products, smart phones / smart watches, IOT products with a keen interest in these technologies.', 'Full-Time (W2 Contractor)']

['', 'Besides an open vacation policy, excellent health and dental insurance, wellness days, 401(k) and a competitive salary - You will get an opportunity to work with a team of dedicated professionals - researchers, attorneys and support staff in a team office environment who strives to provide consistent, accurate information connecting heirs to their rightful inheritances.', 'Organized\xa0', 'Tenacious', 'What you’ll get', 'Creative\xa0– a quick thinker who is able to solve complex cases with ingenuity and speed.Friendly and Persuasive\xa0– a natural conversationalist who rapidly builds relationships of trust, is an\xa0intuitive listener\xa0and is able to influence potential clients on the telephoneTenacious\xa0– plows through barriers and navigates roadblocks as they research time-sensitive cases.Detail-oriented\xa0- can make good judgments and quick decisions based on data and regularly works on projects/cases of moderate complexity.Sense of Urgency\xa0– understands the time-sensitive nature of ARB’s business and is motivated to complete tasks quickly with a high degree of quality. Effectively balances short-term tasks with long-term goals.Organized\xa0- builds high-quality plans and develops helpful documentation for all cases. With the help of others, stays on top of complex laws, regulations or situations related to a case.', 'Researcher', 'Qualifications', 'Detail-oriented\xa0', 'Like an unsolved mystery, the people at ARB enjoy searching the past to solve the mysteries of the present. With a best-in-class research team - employing proprietary data gathering techniques and technologies - ARB has a unique capacity for success. Hard work and passion moves us forward but we derive our greatest satisfaction from that moment in a client engagement when it becomes certain we’ve accomplished what we set out to do.', 'Creative\xa0', 'Who we are', 'With minimal supervision, the\xa0Researcher will work with the research director as a member of the research team in assessing cases that present a financial opportunity for ARB. This job will be\xa0focused on conducting internal research and then\xa0calling and connecting with potential heirs to cultivate relationships into clients for ARB.\xa0Strong ability to multi-task,\xa0prioritize and develop a trusting rapport with people over the phone. The successful candidate will be\xa0assertive and enjoys being on the phone with people without the high\xa0pressure of unreasonable sales quotas.\xa0The work involves continuous new and moderately complex cases each day and much of the work will include the following:', "Bachelor's degree or equivalent in years of experience with a strong preference for research and evaluation, or a related field.Investigative by Nature- asks a cascading set of questions to research a case. Can speak, write and get to the point when dealing with lots of data and information, can present and persuade people on the phone.", 'Tenacious\xa0– plows through barriers and navigates roadblocks as they research time-sensitive cases.', 'Sense of Urgency\xa0– understands the time-sensitive nature of ARB’s business and is motivated to complete tasks quickly with a high degree of quality. Effectively balances short-term tasks with long-term goals.', 'Our mission is to employ time-tested genealogical research and investigative methods to connect heirs to their rightful inheritances and, in some cases, re-establish long-forgotten family relationships.', 'Creative\xa0– a quick thinker who is able to solve complex cases with ingenuity and speed.', 'Investigative by Nature- asks a cascading set of questions to research a case. Can speak, write and get to the point when dealing with lots of data and information, can present and persuade people on the phone.', 'Why we are different', 'intuitive listener', 'The Mission\xa0', 'Responsibilities', 'Organized\xa0- builds high-quality plans and develops helpful documentation for all cases. With the help of others, stays on top of complex laws, regulations or situations related to a case.', 'Friendly and Persuasive\xa0– a natural conversationalist who rapidly builds relationships of trust, is an\xa0intuitive listener\xa0and is able to influence potential clients on the telephone', 'Friendly and Persuasive', 'We are honest brokers in helping to connect people with rightful assets, with long-forgotten relatives and, most importantly, with well-deserved peace of mind.', 'Detail-oriented\xa0- can make good judgments and quick decisions based on data and regularly works on projects/cases of moderate complexity.', 'Sense of Urgency', "Bachelor's degree or equivalent in years of experience with a strong preference for research and evaluation, or a related field.", 'American Research Bureau (ARB), a Utah-based company has built a durable heritage of connecting heirs with their rightful inheritances for more than 80 years.', "Our client is on a mission to employ time-tested genealogical research and investigative methods to connect people to their rightful inheritances and, in some cases, re-establish long-forgotten family relationships. The client's work is built on a foundation of best-in-class research capability, and a commitment to honesty, transparency, and professionalism, that continually provide top-tier service for clients worldwide.", 'It is on a foundation of best-in-class research capability, and a commitment to honesty, transparency, and professionalism, that we continually provide top-tier service for clients worldwide.']

job_title: Sr. Researcher - Advanced 3D Computer Vision and Graphics Research
job_text: ['', 'All candidates must be authorized to work in the USA.', 'Experience and research track record in machine learning based 3D human modeling.', 'Familiarity with Matlab, Python or C/C++ for rapid algorithm prototyping.', 'Preferred qualifications:', 'Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.Strong research background and demonstrated record of innovation in the area of 3D computer vision, computer graphics.Experience in 3D reconstruction, 3D modeling, image-based rendering, or CG physical simulation.Excellent analytical and mathematical skills.Ability to work independently and/or in a team environment.Strong communication and presentation skills.Ability to travel domestically and internationally on occasion.All candidates must be authorized to work in the USA.', 'Two or more years of related professional experience', 'Sony R&D Center US', 'Strong research background and demonstrated record of innovation in the area of 3D computer vision, computer graphics.', 'Ability to travel domestically and internationally on occasion.', 'Familiarity with Unity, Unreal Engine, Maya, or related graphic platforms.', 'As a Senior Research Engineer, you will be involved in an applied scientific research on novel 3D Computer Vision and Graphics algorithm development. You will have a unique opportunity to collaborate with Sony’s professional creators, Sony’s research community world-wide, and U.S. university collaborators.', 'Ability to work independently and/or in a team environment.', 'We’re inventing the technology and products that inspire creators and people all over the world, and soon you could be working to bring your ideas to life! If you’re up to the challenge, we’d love to see what you’ve got!\xa0', 'Excellent analytical and mathematical skills.', 'Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.', 'San Jose, CA', 'Strong communication and presentation skills.', 'Experience in 3D reconstruction, 3D modeling, image-based rendering, or CG physical simulation.', 'Experience and research track record in machine learning based 3D human modeling.Familiarity with Matlab, Python or C/C++ for rapid algorithm prototyping.Familiarity with Unity, Unreal Engine, Maya, or related graphic platforms.Two or more years of related professional experience', 'Sony R&D Center US, located in San Jose, CA is seeking a creative individual to join our talented multidisciplinary core research group. ['This position will be based in New Haven, CT*Position SummaryThe Research Scientist II supports research and development programs through the identification of preclinical and clinical biomarkers of disease activity and/or response to therapeutic treatment, the development of bioanalytical methods including cell-based methodology, the design and execution of experiments at the bench, the interpretation and presentation of data, translation into clinical programs and provides representation on cross-functional teams.Principal Responsibilities Independently research, design, troubleshoot, execute and interpret experiments, synthesize and communicate conclusions  Identify or discover biomarkers and develop, optimize and validate biomarker assays Lead a team to accomplish goals. Able to manage junior scientists or associates. Multi-task multiple projects, prioritizing appropriately and allocating effort Distill complex issues, articulate potential solutions and prioritize appropriately, but may seek coaching and feedback Serve as functional representative to project teams, able to knowledgeably and confidently represent the biomarkers team Excellent communication and presentation skills. Able to communicate the scientific story within Alexion and at external meetings and conferences Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well as a member of a team Qualifications The Research Scientist II should have 3 - 5 years of relevant academic or industrial postdoctoral experience and exemplify the following attributes: Proven track record of creativity, innovation, independent thought and experimental design to deliver definitive results Ability to successfully execute and manage multiple projects simultaneously Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills; ability to successfully work as part of a team but also able to lead an inter-departmental project or initiative involving other contributors to accomplish a defined goal Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. Solid track record of significant contribution to publications in peer reviewed journals and/or presentations at scientific meetings   Expertise in development, optimization and execution of biochemical, molecular and protein-based methods (e.g. expression analysis, chromatography, Westerns, enzyme assays, IHC, siRNA, RT-PCR, etc.). Next-Gen Sequencing and/or single cell analysis experience would be a plus Expertise in cell culture and cell-based assay development and validation including flow cytometry, confocal, reporter and signaling assays (utilizing primary, stem and/or transformed cells) in support of research and development initiatives Ability to identify relevant biomarkers that connect disease pathophysiology and response to treatment, develop, optimize, and validate biomarker assays in support of pre-clinical and clinical drug studies Experience in transferring assays to CROs and successful validation and delivery of quality results under tight timelines, either individually or as part of a team Familiarity with clinical sample handling and interpretation of clinical data is preferred Subject matter expertise (SME) in neuroinflammatory and/or neurodegenerative disorders and/or complement-mediated disease is strongly preferred Education Ph.D. or equivalent degree in Cell or Molecular Biology, Immunology, Pharmacology, Biochemistry, or other biomedical science with 3 - 5 years of relevant academic or industrial postdoctoral experience ', 'Subject matter expertise (SME) in neuroinflammatory and/or neurodegenerative disorders and/or complement-mediated disease is strongly preferred', ' Proven track record of creativity, innovation, independent thought and experimental design to deliver definitive results Ability to successfully execute and manage multiple projects simultaneously Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills; ability to successfully work as part of a team but also able to lead an inter-departmental project or initiative involving other contributors to accomplish a defined goal Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. Able to communicate the scientific story within Alexion and at external meetings and conferences', 'Independently research, design, troubleshoot, execute and interpret experiments, synthesize and communicate conclusions ', 'Identify or discover biomarkers and develop, optimize and validate biomarker assays', 'LIDI-1', 'This position will be based in New Haven, CT*Position SummaryThe Research Scientist II supports research and development programs through the identification of preclinical and clinical biomarkers of disease activity and/or response to therapeutic treatment, the development of bioanalytical methods including cell-based methodology, the design and execution of experiments at the bench, the interpretation and presentation of data, translation into clinical programs and provides representation on cross-functional teams.Principal Responsibilities Independently research, design, troubleshoot, execute and interpret experiments, synthesize and communicate conclusions  Identify or discover biomarkers and develop, optimize and validate biomarker assays Lead a team to accomplish goals. Able to communicate the scientific story within Alexion and at external meetings and conferences Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well as a member of a team Qualifications The Research Scientist II should have 3 - 5 years of relevant academic or industrial postdoctoral experience and exemplify the following attributes: Proven track record of creativity, innovation, independent thought and experimental design to deliver definitive results Ability to successfully execute and manage multiple projects simultaneously Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills; ability to successfully work as part of a team but also able to lead an inter-departmental project or initiative involving other contributors to accomplish a defined goal Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. Solid track record of significant contribution to publications in peer reviewed journals and/or presentations at scientific meetings   Expertise in development, optimization and execution of biochemical, molecular and protein-based methods (e.g. expression analysis, chromatography, Westerns, enzyme assays, IHC, siRNA, RT-PCR, etc.). Next-Gen Sequencing and/or single cell analysis experience would be a plus Expertise in cell culture and cell-based assay development and validation including flow cytometry, confocal, reporter and signaling assays (utilizing primary, stem and/or transformed cells) in support of research and development initiatives Ability to identify relevant biomarkers that connect disease pathophysiology and response to treatment, develop, optimize, and validate biomarker assays in support of pre-clinical and clinical drug studies Experience in transferring assays to CROs and successful validation and delivery of quality results under tight timelines, either individually or as part of a team Familiarity with clinical sample handling and interpretation of clinical data is preferred Subject matter expertise (SME) in neuroinflammatory and/or neurodegenerative disorders and/or complement-mediated disease is strongly preferred Education Ph.D. or equivalent degree in Cell or Molecular Biology, Immunology, Pharmacology, Biochemistry, or other biomedical science with 3 - 5 years of relevant academic or industrial postdoctoral experience LIDI-1,Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the extraordinary opportunity to change lives. At Alexion, such opportunities arise through our unwavering mission to serve patients and families affected by rare diseases. These patients are our guiding star, and we act with integrity, urgency, and discipline because we know their lives are at stake.Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. As a leader in rare diseases for more than 25 years, Alexion has developed and commercializes two approved complement inhibitors to treat patients with paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) and atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS), as well as the first and only approved complement inhibitor to treat anti-acetylcholine receptor (AchR) antibody-positive generalized myasthenia gravis (gMG) and neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (NMOSD). Alexion also has two highly innovative enzyme replacement therapies for patients with life-threatening and ultra-rare metabolic disorders, hypophosphatasia (HPP) and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency (LAL-D) as well as the first and only approved Factor Xa inhibitor reversal agent. In addition, the company is developing several mid-to-late-stage therapies, including a copper-binding agent for Wilson disease, an anti-neonatal Fc receptor (FcRn) antibody for rare Immunoglobulin G (IgG)-mediated diseases and an oral Factor D inhibitor as well as several early-stage therapies, including one for light chain (AL) amyloidosis, a second oral Factor D inhibitor and a third complement inhibitor. Alexion focuses its research efforts on novel molecules and targets in the complement cascade and its development efforts on the core therapeutic areas of hematology, nephrology, neurology, metabolic disorders and cardiology. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.As a leading employer in our industry, Alexion is proud to offer a highly competitive package of base and incentive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the health, wellness and financial security of our employees and their families. Benefits include group medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more.', 'Serve as functional representative to project teams, able to knowledgeably and confidently represent the biomarkers team', 'Experience in transferring assays to CROs and successful validation and delivery of quality results under tight timelines, either individually or as part of a team']

The service is completely free for customers who pay on time\xa0- helping people spend responsibly without incurring interest, fees or extended debt!', '• Design research studies that drive tactical and strategic product decisions\xa0', '• Experience in asking, as well as answering questions in a business context', 'Preferred Qualifications\xa0', '• Award winning culture', 'If you are brave, if you are committed to doing the right thing, if you always keep it real, and your background matches the description above then please apply today!\xa0Afterpay is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new team members, in addition to current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.', '• Lead and deliver research share-outs to build empathy with users\xa0', '• Bachelor, Masters or PhD degree in a social science (e.g. Psychology, Sociology, Political Science, Economics), or in a quantitative field (e.g. Statistics, Data Science)', '• Experience in communicating analyses to technical and non-technical audiences', 'Afterpay is offered by more than 55,000 of the world’s best retailers and has more than 10 million active customers globally. In the U.S. more than 5 million customers use Afterpay and is offered by more than 15,000 of the top fashion and beauty retailers across the country - including Anthropologie, Forever 21, DSW, GOAT, Finish Line, Levi’s, Mac Cosmetics, Ray-Ban and many others.\xa0We are currently available in Australia, New Zealand, the United States and the United Kingdom where the brand is called Clearpay. Our U.S. headquarters are located at the heart of the retail and business district in San Francisco, California.', '• Experience with Conjoint and MaxDiff survey analysis\xa0', 'How to Apply', '• Competitive compensation packages', '• Experience applying multivariate statistical methods such as GLM, regression, matching,\xa0ANOVA, hierarchical linear (random effects) modeling to user research problems\xa0', '• Knowledge in quantitative research methodologies (for example: survey sampling and design, significance testing, regression modeling, experimental design, behavioral data analysis)', 'Afterpay is looking for a quantitative UX researcher to help develop our understanding of what our customers want. The ideal candidate has an innate curiosity about human behavior and strives to understand why people behave the way they do.\xa0', 'What We Offer', '• Supportive, laid-back environment\xa0', '• Experience in data manipulation and analysis using statistical tools (R, SQL and or Python)', 'Key Responsibilities', '• Work with cross-functional partners in product management, analytics, design and data science to identify and prioritize knowledge gaps in our understanding of the Afterpay experience\xa0', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Afterpay is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new team members, in addition to current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.', '• Fun virtual company events & collaborative team', '• Experience conducting research in a business or consulting environment, including working with stakeholders to understand their research needs', '• Communicate results and recommendations in compelling and creative ways', '• Medical, Dental, Vision insurance (100% covered!)', '• Experience with unmoderated research methods', 'Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins.\xa0', 'The Role', 'Our Company']

job_title: AI Research scientist: up to $350,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting-edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. We have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We are backed by Eric Schmidt and Decibel Ventures with Series A funding of $18 million.\xa0', 'General Requirements:', 'Coming up with new techniques in unsupervised learning, dataset augmentation, and deep reinforcement learning that can be applied to automating various parts of the AI development workflow.', 'Job Description:', 'We are looking for talented research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Candidates will need to have a PhD preferably in Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning. We are looking for people who have done research and/or published papers in one of the following areas: Unsupervised Learning; Generative Modeling; Deep Neural Networks; Deep Reinforcement Learning; Generative Adversarial Networks; Causal Reasoning. Ideal candidates would be able to rapidly build on new ideas with engineers, potentially publish at top conferences, and be able to write code.']

job_title: Research Scientist – Advanced ML – DL Methods and Learning Frameworks
job_text: ['', 'Innovative thinker and quick learner with the ability to identify, propose and lead new research projects', "PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or RoboticsExperience with one or more cloud computing tools (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.)Software development and architecting experience creating ML pipelines at scaleExperience with AutoML type frameworksProficiency with Mathworks ML-DL librariesBackground implementing AI-ML algorithms on resource constrained edge devices such as on inferencing systems NVDIA(TX-), NXP (Tree-Runner) etc.Exceptional communication, teamwork and problem-solving skillsInnovative thinker and quick learner with the ability to identify, propose and lead new research projectsPassionate about staying abreast of challenges and exciting changes in ML and DL and their real time realizations for quickly establishing applicability to Ford engineering problems in order to build/contribute to the Ford's strategic and leadership vision", " Today, we are exploring and delivering ways to make smarter vehicles and our transportation system more efficient to improve people's lives by helping them move more freely, safely and enjoyably. For example, we are changing how our products are made by creating high-quality vehicles in an environmentally and socially responsible way, including the use sustainable materials. Since 2000, we have used 12 industry and world-first plant-based materials in our production vehicles. We also are researching the possible use of tomato skin, bamboo, agave fiber, dandelion roots, algae and coffee chaff as part of our ambitious goal of making our vehicles with up of 20 percent sustainable material by 2025.", 'What you will receive in return', ' As part of the Ford family, you will enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You will also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.', 'Background implementing AI-ML algorithms on resource constrained edge devices such as on inferencing systems NVDIA(TX-), NXP (Tree-Runner) etc.', "Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or Robotics", 'Experience with AutoML type frameworks', 'Our preferred requirements', 'Create end-to-end workflow for integrating various aspects of a ML-based solution architecture in a full design cycle that includes data preparation (including augmentation), model selection, robustness checks and model compression for deployment', 'PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or Robotics', 'A year or more of experience (academic research and/or industry) in Object Oriented Programming/Functional Programming for architecting scalable research oriented development frameworks and workflows', ' Visa sponsorship may be available for this position.', 'Proficiency with Mathworks ML-DL libraries', 'One plus year of experience (academic research and/or industry) working with Databases and Big Data tools such as Apache, Mongo, Tableau etc.', 'One or more years (academic research and/or industry) in developing with Python and a common DL framework (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Caffe etc.)', 'Publish internally and engage in internal knowledge dissemination', 'Experience with one or more cloud computing tools (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.)', "At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow's transportation.", " The Core Artificial Intelligence-Machine Learning (AI-ML) research group, within Ford's Research and Advanced Engineering area, is driving the discovery and implementation of AI-ML across all engineering functions within the Ford product landscape. Our exciting work requires highly qualified and motivated individuals who are ready to take on ambitious, multi-functional problems that require diligent research and out-of-the-box thinking.", ' If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we would love to have you join us.', "Develop through, self-learning and deep research, new mathematical formulations and learning architectures as may become necessary when dealing with atypical/new problem statements. This will often require the synthesis of ML/DL research problem statements in conjunction with SME's and academia to seek out novel applications through re-purposing and/or discovery", 'Exceptional communication, teamwork and problem-solving skills', "Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or RoboticsAt least one year of experience (academic research and/or industry) in DL for one or more application areas including Vision, NLP, Human-Machine Interactions and/or Digital AssistantsOne or more years (academic research and/or industry) in developing with Python and a common DL framework (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Caffe etc.)One plus year of experience (academic research and/or industry) working with Databases and Big Data tools such as Apache, Mongo, Tableau etc.A year or more of experience (academic research and/or industry) in Object Oriented Programming/Functional Programming for architecting scalable research oriented development frameworks and workflows", 'Software development and architecting experience creating ML pipelines at scale', 'At least one year of experience (academic research and/or industry) in DL for one or more application areas including Vision, NLP, Human-Machine Interactions and/or Digital Assistants', " As part of the Core AI-ML team, you'll conduct novel research to advance deep learning (DL) in such areas as vision, speech, decisioning and guidance, robotics, etc. You'll be able to leverage your expertise in software development to craft end-to-end design frameworks for model development, training and deployment. The position involves collaborating with leading researchers in academia, national labs and industry and actively generating intellectual property and publications. You will:", 'The minimum requirements we seek', " Ford's Research and Advanced Engineering team explores new vehicle and societal innovations that require some level of invention before they can be applied to our products and services. The team is building on a history of Ford innovation, including our invention of the three-way catalytic converter to modernize vehicle emissions controls in the 1970s and the world's first rear inflatable seat belts in 2010.", 'Partner with multidisciplinary teams within Research, Product Development, Manufacturing and other organizations to transform research solutions into practical product level embedded solutions', ' By choice, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.', "Develop a research portfolio and lead research, development and progression of state-of-the-art concepts in ML-DL related to multimodal perception and the generation of contextual information for forward use in customer facing applicationsCreate end-to-end workflow for integrating various aspects of a ML-based solution architecture in a full design cycle that includes data preparation (including augmentation), model selection, robustness checks and model compression for deploymentDevelop through, self-learning and deep research, new mathematical formulations and learning architectures as may become necessary when dealing with atypical/new problem statements. This will often require the synthesis of ML/DL research problem statements in conjunction with SME's and academia to seek out novel applications through re-purposing and/or discoveryPartner with multidisciplinary teams within Research, Product Development, Manufacturing and other organizations to transform research solutions into practical product level embedded solutionsCollaborate with application engineers to validate solutions against real-world application benchmarks for quality, robustness and continuous improvementPresent at respected conferences and publish in high-impact peer reviewed journalsPublish internally and engage in internal knowledge dissemination", 'Collaborate with application engineers to validate solutions against real-world application benchmarks for quality, robustness and continuous improvement', 'What you will be able to do', "Passionate about staying abreast of challenges and exciting changes in ML and DL and their real time realizations for quickly establishing applicability to Ford engineering problems in order to build/contribute to the Ford's strategic and leadership vision", 'Develop a research portfolio and lead research, development and progression of state-of-the-art concepts in ML-DL related to multimodal perception and the generation of contextual information for forward use in customer facing applications', 'Present at respected conferences and publish in high-impact peer reviewed journals']

['Strong data orientation with an analytical mindset ', 'We’re looking for a dynamic leader with experience building amazing teams, a knack for data and a passion for ensuring that products we build are used on the ground. This is a remote position that will require some travel to our Los Angeles office. The Program Director, Vaccine Systems Advocacy will provide leadership and overall strategic direction to our largest program, helping us realize our goal of improving the health of everyone, everywhere by shifting the vaccine sector and getting decision makers to rethink how critical interventions are designed, maintained, financed, and scaled. You’ll drive this change by proving the value of data that communicates realities of the current vaccine cold chain, sharing data-driven solutions that have proven to scale and quantifying our impact. With a relentless desire to amplify country voices, you’ll help solutions move away from top down mandates to being country-driven and sustained. Bring your design thinking and vision to pave the way for our next stage of impact! ', 'Articulate the value of using data for our country partners, by collecting data to evaluate both the costs and benefits to countries of using data. ', 'Excellent interpersonal and EQ skills; masterful at giving and receiving feedback and building trust even in challenging situations with internal and external stakeholders. ', 'Develop impact metrics to measure and communicate our impact at scale across all of our vaccine cold chain deployments. Strengthen the delivery of our advocacy strategy by bringing thought leadership and engaging the team in developing data-driven insights and key messages that highlight the state of vaccine/health cold chains today and enable powerful take-aways via reports and conferences. ['', 'Ability to communicate complex information clearly, effectively, and accurately as evidenced by first author publication(s).', 'Job Overview:', '7. Works with the clinical validation team for regulated assay launch', 'Strong computer and bioinformatics skills. Programming experience and/or use of command line tools is a plus.', '1. Provide technical support and interface with Pharmaceutical partners', 'At Ambry, everyone is welcome. A career at Ambry Genetics is a chance to be part of a dynamic company that aims to improve health by understanding the relationships between genetics and human disease. We earned our reputation as industry leaders by responsibly introducing cutting-edge genetic testing solutions and continually sharing what we learn with the global scientific community.', 'Strong previous experience developing clinical or RUO assays for somatic variant detection in cancer using NGS platforms.', '3. Aid in technology improvement of existing tests, e.g. evaluate new reagents, protocol modifications, methods, equipment that may improve the sample throughput and or quality of results, or may provide budgetary savings. ', 'Job Overview: ', 'Proficient in NGS/microarray/qPCR', 'Proficient with a broad range of standard molecular biology techniques, such as PCR, qPCR, RT-PCR, nucleic acid isolation, molecular cloning, NGS library construction, etc., the output of those techniques, how the output is assayed, and the analysis and interpretation of those results.', '5 -7 years research experience in an academic setting and 2 - 5 years industry experience.', 'Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race (and traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to hair texture and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression (including transgender status), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.', 'At Ambry you will be learning, challenging yourself, and having fun while collaborating with teammates through the open exchange of ideas. We also offer access to gym memberships, onsite food trucks, “Lunch and Learns,” and more. Our outstanding benefits program includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, FSA, and generous paid time off (PTO) program. Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and we maintain a drug-free work environment.', 'Ambry Genetics Corporation is a CAP-accredited and CLIA-licensed molecular genetics laboratory based in Aliso Viejo, California. We are a genetics-based healthcare company that is dedicated to open scientific exchange so we can work together to understand and treat all human disease faster.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate and work effectively and positively with all levels of the organization.', 'Job Responsibilities:', '10. Supervise and manage Scientist and Research Associates, including training, mentoring, and review of employee progress. Communicate with Director effectively in regards to project performance and progress.', 'Strong background in and/or knowledge of cancer biology and the useful diagnostic markers, approaches to detection, and limitations of existing methods.', 'The AGS Sr. Scientist is responsible for the hands-on development and oversight of new assays, maintenance of existing tests, and project planning and budgeting for Pharmaceutical partners. In addition, the Senior Scientist is expected to assist in strategic decision making, stay informed with respect to advances in the fields of genomics, genetic testing, and promising new technologies/ approaches that support Ambry’s Pharma business objectives. The position requires frequent and close collaboration across AGS as well as external departments and is best suited for a candidate who can efficiently work in a goal-oriented research and development setting.', '4. Interfaces the AGS Director, Clinical Laboratory Directors, Compliance, Genetic Counselors, Information Technology, Project Managers, Bioinformatics and Marketing to assure efficient development and implementation of new technologies and workflows for each offering. ', '6. Design research strategy, plan experiments and budget, estimate project timelines, identify risks and contingencies.', '2. Develop new tests with existing or novel methods for Pharma partners, including targeted NGS, microarray, qPCR or ddPCR, etc. ', '5. Research new projects for potential development. May include literature research for project utility and scope.', '9. Programming experience and/or use of command line tools is a plus.5 -7 years research experience in an academic setting and 2 - 5 years industry experience.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate and work effectively and positively with all levels of the organization.', 'Ph.D degree in a life sciences field (Biology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field) with 4 yrs post-graduate experience', 'Ambry does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters, third party recruiting agencies, outside recruiters or firms without an executed contract in place. We are not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received by Ambry. Such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Ambry and will be processed accordingly.', 'About Us:\xa0', 'Hands-on experience generating, troubleshooting, and analyzing large complex datasets, such as those obtained from high throughput functional genomics screens, microarray, NGS, and/or proteomics experiments.', 'Job Requirements:', '8. Draft papers and lead or assist with data analysis and compilation for purposes of publications, patents, and marketing.']

job_title: Research Scientist - Senior Scientist, Biology & Pharmacology
job_text: ['', 'The expected work will include regular office responsibilities as well as standard in vivo biology & pharmacology laboratory work.', 'PhD in relevant biological discipline (ideally with immunology and / or respiratory disease experience) with 5+ years pharmaceutical research experience. A good understanding of PK/PD relationships is expected.', 'The successful candidate will have a cross-functional in vivo / in vitro skillset of high quality with a strong track record of past project successes. This candidate will work closely with a Biology & Pharmacology leader and have project core team responsibilities on either one or multiple projects. The candidate is expected to execute, lead, and quickly gain expertise independently as a trusted scientific contributor.', '\xa0', 'Duties and Responsibilities', 'Qualifications', 'Possess excellent time-management skills and manage oversight of multiple experiments in concurrently.', 'Physical Requirements', '\ufeff', 'The incumbent may be required to sit, stand and walk for extended periods of time.\xa0The incumbent may be required to climb, bend, lift, carry and kneel.\xa0Because of the volume of work performed by computer and telephone, the incumbent will spend a considerable amount of time looking at the computer monitors and using his/her hands to operate office equipment.', 'Ability to manage and provide career development for junior reports as necessary.', 'Experience with cutting-edge technologies including single-cell RNA sequencing, digital spatial profiling and imaging, complex in vivo disease biology models, drug delivery systems (e.g. inhalation towers and delivery to apical surface of in vitro airway liquid interface cultures), organotypic primary culture or 3-D microphysiological systems validation, and sourcing and handling of patient-derived primary samples from collaborators and clinical studies, is preferred.', 'Will provide technical scientific input.', 'Provide scientific input and execute studies in support of organ-selective small-molecule projects.', 'Contribute during internal research meeting data discussions and interface with cross-functional groups.', 'Will work closely with a Biology & Pharmacology leader as well as project team leader to design and implement the internal and external experimental plans.', 'Job Purpose', 'Responsibilities will focus on disease efficacy proof of concept, biomarker development, clinical dose-projection, as well as differentiation and complementation with other standards of care and emerging therapies. This work requires a sophisticated understanding of disease biology, local routes of administration (e.g. inhalation in the lung), and the clinical development plan and target product profile of projects.', 'This scientific position within the Biology & Pharmacology group at Theravance Biopharma will focus on translational biology at the interface of late research and early clinical development with an emphasis on in vivo work. This important position presents an opportunity to design and execute the experimental biology and pharmacology strategy in support of our exciting internal programs, in which we focus on applying an organ-selective approach to discover transformative medicines.', 'Demonstrate excellent communication skills with the proven ability to work effectively as a member of a multidisciplinary team.', 'Provide scientific input and execute studies in support of organ-selective small-molecule projects.Will work closely with a Biology & Pharmacology leader as well as project team leader to design and implement the internal and external experimental plans.Will provide technical scientific input.Contribute during internal research meeting data discussions and interface with cross-functional groups.Possess excellent time-management skills and manage oversight of multiple experiments in concurrently.Demonstrate excellent communication skills with the proven ability to work effectively as a member of a multidisciplinary team.', 'Working Conditions', 'Direct Reports', 'The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.']

['This person will be responsible for designing and conducting user experience research and analyses that lead to genuinely actionable recommendations.\xa0 Responsible for finding innovative ways to research customer issues, explain their findings and proposing recommendations for change.Ensuring that research data are consistently and accurately gathered, broadly communicated and archived. This position will provide significant input into decisions that shape customer experience, optimization plans, and site design and product development. Responsible for planning, recruiting and conducting user research, including methods such as: usability lab studies, ethnographic field studies, competitive evaluations, participatory design sessions, surveys, heuristic evaluations, cognitive walkthroughs and similar approaches. Use data from multiple sources (e.g. user research, on-site testing, VOC tools, business intelligence tools) to develop insights and recommendations for improving our site performance. Partner with product, product design, technology, and marketing communications to represents user needs and deliver meaningful changes for customers Create clear presentations which highlight the impact of the customer experience on business results, and impactful insights Keep up to date with UX research techniques and emerging research tools. Planning research, writing interview protocols, and executing UI research through in-person and remote qualitative research to create a new understanding of user’s wants and needs for our new mobile applications. job_title: Clinical Data Scientist II / 40 Hours / BWH - Data Science and Analytics
job_text: ['', ' Experience with managing several concurrent, complex projects required (2 years minimum) ', ' Strong experience with medical claims data analysis is a must, familiarity with data sets provided by the Central for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) such as MEDPAR is a plus ', ' Familiarity and experience with Agile development principles is a plus ', ' Masters’ degree required in data science, biomedical informatics, statistics/biostatistics, epidemiology, economics/econometrics, or related disciplines (PhD is a plus) ', ' Creates innovative visualizations of the data to effectively communicate analytical results ', 'Job', ' Consults with clinical leaders to understand problems and goals, and translate these needs into advanced analytics solutions ', ' Manages large and complex analytical projects through data exploration and modeling, testing and evaluation ', 'Primary Location', 'Standard Hours', ' Demonstrates superior communication skills, and ability to develop and participate in presentations and consultations on analytics results and solutions ', ' 3-5 years of relevant, progressively complex experience in data management in an industry setting required ', 'Schedule', ' Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving capabilities required ', ' Mentors others and champions a culture of transparent feedback and continuous learning ', ' Clinically oriented background or professional experience is a plus ', ' Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail required ', ' Wrangles structured and unstructured data to solve complex business problems ', ' Applies statistical rigor to analyze large amounts of data using advance data science techniques ', 'Work Locations', ' Demonstrated experience with data mining and predictive modeling techniques required; familiarity with neural networks and Bayesian modeling techniques is a plus. ', 'Responsibilities', ' Quickly develops subject-matter expertise by fully understanding the complex methodologies used for measurement of healthcare outcomes ', ' Translates the data artifacts into clinical and business insights, and delivers these insights through presentations prepared for audiences at various levels of leadership and technical expertise ', ' Deep understanding of platforms and languages to analyze large data sets from multiple sources preferred ', ' Closely collaborates with analysts and data engineers at the Decision Support Systems (DSS) team at the Brigham, as well as the Partners eCare (PeC) reporting team at Partners HealthCare, to develop technical and business approaches and/or enhanced technical tools ', '  Masters’ degree required in data science, biomedical informatics, statistics/biostatistics, epidemiology, economics/econometrics, or related disciplines (PhD is a plus)   Strong experience with medical claims data analysis is a must, familiarity with data sets provided by the Central for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) such as MEDPAR is a plus   3-5 years of relevant, progressively complex experience in data management in an industry setting required   Demonstrated experience with observational and interventional study designs required   Demonstrated experience with data mining and predictive modeling techniques required; familiarity with neural networks and Bayesian modeling techniques is a plus.   Deep understanding of platforms and languages to analyze large data sets from multiple sources preferred   Experience with electronic health record (EHR) data preferred (experience with Epic Systems highly preferred)   Strong skills with SQL, R and python required. Broad experience in programming across different platforms and languages preferred.   Experience with managing several concurrent, complex projects required (2 years minimum)   Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail required   Excellent communication and writing skills required   Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving capabilities required   Clinically oriented background or professional experience is a plus   Familiarity and experience with Agile development principles is a plus  ', '  Develops and/or uses statistical algorithms and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and predict future outcomes   Consults with clinical leaders to understand problems and goals, and translate these needs into advanced analytics solutions   Quickly develops subject-matter expertise by fully understanding the complex methodologies used for measurement of healthcare outcomes   Applies statistical rigor to analyze large amounts of data using advance data science techniques   Wrangles structured and unstructured data to solve complex business problems   Manages large and complex analytical projects through data exploration and modeling, testing and evaluation   Closely collaborates with analysts and data engineers at the Decision Support Systems (DSS) team at the Brigham, as well as the Partners eCare (PeC) reporting team at Partners HealthCare, to develop technical and business approaches and/or enhanced technical tools   Creates innovative visualizations of the data to effectively communicate analytical results   Translates the data artifacts into clinical and business insights, and delivers these insights through presentations prepared for audiences at various levels of leadership and technical expertise   Demonstrates superior communication skills, and ability to develop and participate in presentations and consultations on analytics results and solutions   Works closely with thought leaders in clinical, analytics and data science areas at the Brigham and Women’s Hospital and across Mass General Brigham to reuse and share knowledge, tools and methodologies   Mentors others and champions a culture of transparent feedback and continuous learning  ', 'Employee Status', 'Shift', 'Job Posting', ' Excellent communication and writing skills required ', ' Experience with electronic health record (EHR) data preferred (experience with Epic Systems highly preferred) ', ' Develops and/or uses statistical algorithms and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and predict future outcomes ', ' Strong skills with SQL, R and python required. Broad experience in programming across different platforms and languages preferred. ', ' Works closely with thought leaders in clinical, analytics and data science areas at the Brigham and Women’s Hospital and across Mass General Brigham to reuse and share knowledge, tools and methodologies ', 'Organization', ' Demonstrated experience with observational and interventional study designs required ', 'Recruiting Department']

['\xa0', 'This exciting, fast-paced start up looking to bring innovation to redefine the content management experience and changing how content is delivered to clients. With an amazing team already established, they are looking to add a few talented revolutionaries who want to make a difference solving big problems and contributing to impactful and meaningful work.', '§\xa03+ years experience performing model training / algorithm development optimizing for speed, size or accuracy and developing / refining\xa0new and existing training sets.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Competitive Salary – up to $200k for right individual', 'They are seeking a\xa0Sr. Machine Learning Engineer\xa0to work collaboratively with highly talented team members to conduct applied research in generative adversarial networks (GANs) and related methods to generate content. The ideal candidate has experience\xa0applying state of the art machine learning and computer vision algorithms and deep learning frameworks with experience in GANs and related deep learning methods.', 'Role – Lead Machine Learning Engineer', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0401(k) Matching', '§\xa03+ years experience in selecting or developing algorithms for performing a variety of machine learning and computer vision tasks', 'Preferred Qualifications', '§\xa02+ years experience coding GANs.', 'Qualifications\xa0', '§\xa0Strong understanding of Machine Learning processes such as feature extraction, statistical approaches, linear and non-linear classifiers, and deep learning including one or more approaches such as\xa0CNNs, SVM, and Bayesian Networks.', 'Location – Reston, Virginia (Remote)', '§\xa0Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Math, Statistics or related fields with specialization in machine learning and/or computer vision.', '§\xa03+ years experience in applying and adapting the latest research in machine learning and computer vision to support business objectives including prototype development and product integration.', '§\xa0Proficiency in in Image Processing, Image Analysis, and/or Computer Vision', 'Salary – Up to $200k base plus benefits', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0100% Company paid medical/dental/vision/life/disability plans', 'Benefits', '§\xa0Computer vision experience in 3D computer vision tasks', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Flexible Savings Accounts (FSA)', '§\xa0Experience with a diverse set of generative modeling\xa0techniques.', '§\xa0Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, or Torch']

company: Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc.
job_text: ['A strong research and record of written productivity as evidenced by peer-reviewed publications in international journals and potentially fellowship applications. ', 'The individual will work closely with the P.I. performing experiments, analyzing data, and writing manuscripts', 'Tissue and cell immunolabeling for confocal microscopy', 'PCR, Western blot, subcellular fractionationJOB QUALIFICATIONS:', 'Applicants must have a recent Ph.D. or the equivalent ', 'The candidate must have the ability to work efficiently, great problem-solving ability, excellent organizational skills, be fluent in English, should have good writing skills, and excellent interpersonal skills.Background Investigation/Justice Center Review Requirements: Prospective appointees will be: 1) Checked against the Staff Exclusion List (SEL) maintained by the Justice Center for the Protection of People with Special Needs. Prospective employees whose names appear on the SEL as having been found responsible for serious or repeated acts of abuse or neglect will be barred from appointment. 2) Screened against the Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment (SCR).Prospective employees whose names are indicated on the SCR may be barred from appointment.*The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York.Employees of the Research Foundation are not state employees, do not participate in any state retirement system, and do not receive state fringe benefits. Excellent Benefits Package. Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer/Minority/Women/Disabled/Veteran Employer. VEVRAA 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) compliant.Applications will only be accepted through website at: http://corporate.rfmh.org - Click on Employment Opportunities. Applications will be accepted only during the posting dates as listed at the top of the job announcement.Questions regarding this position please email: hr@rfmh.org']
